Photo: Courtesy Photo 22 things every San Antonio Spurs fan should know about the Coyote Image 5 of 27 1. His full name is Entertainus Carnivorus.
Photo: COURTESY PHOTO 1. His full name is Entertainus Carnivorus. Image 6 of 27 2. He’s a Pisces. March 15 is the Coyote’s birthday, which he shares with Eva Longoria, Bret Michaels, Fabio, Wil.i.am, Sly Stallone, the Iron Sheik, Ruth Bader Ginsberg and the state of Maine.
Photo: San Antonio Express-News 2. He’s a Pisces. March 15 is the Coyote’s birthday, which he... Image 7 of 27 3. The Coyote is 224 in dog years. He joined the Spurs in 1983, the year Carrie Underwood and Kim Jong-un were born. Tim Duncan was in the second grade, and Tony Parker was a baby in the crib. This was also the year of ‘Scarface,’ ‘Flashdance’ and ‘Christine.’ And Michael Jackson’s ‘Billie Jean’ and ‘Beat It’ ruled the airwaves.
Photo: TOM REEL, San Antonio Express-News 3. The Coyote is 224 in dog years. He joined the Spurs in 1983, the... Image 8 of 27 4. In the beginning, the Coyote made just $25 a game, and his changing room was a bathroom.
Photo: Associated Press 4. In the beginning, the Coyote made just $25 a game, and his... Image 9 of 27 5. At his first game, a Spurs player mistook him for a reindeer. Today, you can see the Coyote's face featured on the team's bus.
Photo: Kin Man Hui, San Antonio Express-News 5. At his first game, a Spurs player mistook him for a reindeer.... Image 10 of 27 6. The Coyote has only four fingers, he’s left-handed and he’s been known to lose his eyes.
Photo: Gary Miller, San Antonio Express-News 6. The Coyote has only four fingers, he’s left-handed and he’s... Image 11 of 27 7. If you think he’s a wild bachelor, think again. Mrs. Coyote domesticated him a while back.
7. If you think he’s a wild bachelor, think again. Mrs. Coyote... Image 12 of 27 8. He's now a dad with a teenage son.
8. He's now a dad with a teenage son. Image 13 of 27 9. In the 1990s, the Spurs Coyote, along with his pal the Phoenix Suns Gorilla, pioneered the T-shirt cannon, aka the Gatlin Gun.
Photo: San Antonio Express-News 9. In the 1990s, the Spurs Coyote, along with his pal the... Image 14 of 27 10. The Coyote holds the NBA record for most T-shirts launched during a timeout.
Photo: Darren Abate, Associated Press 10. The Coyote holds the NBA record for most T-shirts launched... Image 15 of 27 11. He is the first mascot in NBA history to dunk both a basketball and a doughnut in a single game.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas, San Antonio Express-News 11. He is the first mascot in NBA history to dunk both a basketball... Image 16 of 27 12. The Coyote is also the first mascot to be ejected from a game. This happened in 2005, and he was later pardoned by Texas Governor Rick Perry.
Photo: Ronald Martinez, San Antonio Express-News 12. The Coyote is also the first mascot to be ejected from a game.... Image 17 of 27 13. The Coyote can make over 400 community appearances a year. Some years, it’s more than 500.
Photo: Lisa Krantz, San Antonio Express-News 13. The Coyote can make over 400 community appearances a year. Some... Image 18 of 27 14. His favorite band is Los Lobos.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas, By Edward A. Ornelas, Express-News 14. His favorite band is Los Lobos. Image 19 of 27 15. Tim Derk, a graduate from Trinity University, was the man inside the Coyote suit for the first 21 years. With more than 5,000 appearances, he forged the Coyote’s playful personality until a stroke sidelined him in 2004. Derk is now the manager of mascot development for Spurs Sports and Entertainment.
Photo: JOHN DAVENPORT, SAN ANTONIO EXPRESS-NEWS 15. Tim Derk, a graduate from Trinity University, was the man... Image 20 of 27 16. The Coyote received a trophy for Mascot of the Year in 2005.
Photo: TOM REEL 16. The Coyote received a trophy for Mascot of the Year in 2005. Image 21 of 27 17. During the 2012 All-Star Weekend, the Coyote helped break a Guinness record for "most between-the-legs basketball dunks by a team of mascots in one minute." In addition to the Coyote, the team of mascots included Sly (New Jersey Nets), Grizz (Memphis Grizzlies), Hooper (Detroit Pistons) and Rufus Lynx (Charlotte Bobcats).
17. During the 2012 All-Star Weekend, the Coyote helped break a... Image 22 of 27 18. The Coyote’s home pad is a lavish den outside Loop 1604.
Photo: Rubiola Realty Listings 18. The Coyote’s home pad is a lavish den outside Loop 1604. Image 23 of 27 19. Naturally, his favorite food is roadrunner tacos, but he admits a weakness for Fried San Diego Chicken.
Photo: FREDERIC J. BROWN, San Antonio Express-News 19. Naturally, his favorite food is roadrunner tacos, but he admits... Image 24 of 27 20. The nuns from the Salesian Sisters of St. John Bosco love and pray for him.
Photo: Bob Owen, San Antonio Express-News 20. The nuns from the Salesian Sisters of St. John Bosco love and... Image 25 of 27 21. The Coyote was inducted into the Mascot Hall of Fame in 2007. Fellow hall of famers include Houston Rockets’ Clutch the Bear, New York’s Mr. Met and the Suns’s Gorilla.
Photo: Ronald Martinez, San Antonio Express-News 21. The Coyote was inducted into the Mascot Hall of Fame in 2007.... Image 26 of 27 22. The Coyote has entertained more than 1,500 home games.
Photo: JERRY LARA, SAN ANTONIO EXPRESS-NEWS 22. The Coyote has entertained more than 1,500 home games. Image 27 of 27 Would your mascot do this? Hilarious Spurs Coyote shakes his tail on top of bar 1 / 27 Back to Gallery The Spurs Coyote proved any time and any place can be the prime time to party, even in the middle of the week on top of a bar inside the Santikos Palladium Theatre.
“The Spurs Coyote is dancing on the bar,” Spurs fan Markus Estrada tweeted. “It’s literally Coyote Ugly.”
Estrada told mySA.com No.1! made an appearance at the Rookie Tip-Off event held by the Spurs organization at the Palladium for new season ticket holders like himself.
While the rest of the team is practicing their shooting, the furriest member of the squad is polishing his antics on some members of the Spurs family. Estrada said The Coyote had attendees laughing throughout the evening.
The @SpursCoyote is dancing on the bar. It's literally Coyote Ugly.
RELATED: Spurs fans are loving this awesome mural of the Coyote
“He found ways to interact with everyone and took plenty of pictures,” Estrada said. “It amazes me how he’s able to make people laugh without saying a word and that’s what makes him the greatest mascot in the world.”
The green-eyed Spurs mascot showed he’s also not afraid of heights. Estrada said at one point, he jumped atop a balcony to rally fans below.
Along with having a front-row seat to the always-welcomed Coyote shenanigans, ticket holders enjoyed complimentary snacks, drinks and a viewing of The Intern.
memndoza@mysa.com
